adjective.description: Containing or operated by air or gas under pressure.
examples: the machines with pneumatic loading are more efficient

adjective.description: (chiefly in the context of New Testament theology) relating to the spirit.

examples: as with most conventional pneumatics, you have to cock the bolt and load a pellet into the breech by hand before each shot

origin: Early 17th century (in pneumatic (sense 2 of the adjective): from French pneumatique or Latin pneumaticus, from Greek pneumatikos, from pneuma wind, from pnein breathe.
